  Expect soaring vocals, dynamic energy and the unmistakable Zalelo flair in a show that celebrates music across generations and genres.

title: isaacprease
synopsis:
Look forward to an intimate, soulful performance from isaacprease, where raw emotion meets smooth, genre-blending sound. Known for his heartfelt originals like lips on mine and nice dress, issacprease brings an evening of alternative R&B, pop and brooding melodies that will resonate long after the night is over.
  Expect fresh interpretations of well-loved tracks highlighting his artistry and influences. Whether through his originals or reimagined takes, the evening promises an evocative, late-night soundtrack that is not to be missed!

title: Elizabeth Wong
synopsis: Spend a melancholic evening with Elizabeth Wong as she performs soulful indie-folk ballads and intimate originals. With covers of songs from artists like Phoebe Bridgers, Lana Del Rey and Lizzy McAlpine, her set is one heartbreak away—so keep the tissues close for the inevitable tears!

title: Love, In All Forms with Ezekiel Tok
synopsis:
Fleeting crushes, first loves, heartbreak. Ezekiel Tok explores Love, In All Forms as he brings heartbreaking folk-pop live to Esplanade. Be swept up by haunting lyrics and the ethereal musicality of the genre, with covers of songs by Hozier, Noah Kahan and Lake Street Dive, alongside Ezekiel’s own originals.
  Love shows up in many ways—the playful, the awkward, and the soul-crushing. Experience them all in Ezekiel Tok’s evening of love!

title: QUIN
synopsis: Settle in for a relaxing evening with Quin, whose music is filled with warmth, emotion and authenticity. Vibe to a soulful blend of covers of R&B artists like Yebba and Daniel Caesar. Don’t miss this night of dreamy hits and smooth, tender vocals.

title: A Night with Izzan Adlan
synopsis: Get ready for a lively evening with Izzan Adlan, whose unique artistry and captivating presence are not to be missed! He will be performing covers of trending Malaysian and Indonesian songs that have gone viral in recent years, such as hits by Ernie Zakri, Afgan, Judika, Hafiz Suip, and many more.

title: Odelia Rei
synopsis: Journey into Odelia Rei’s world of music, with covers of hit songs and her own originals in genres of pop, indie and mellow R&B. Look forward to an evening of warm melodies and lyrics sprinkled with hope.

title: Elsa Mickayla feat. Ashlyn Owen Li and Rhaun
synopsis: Join singer-songwriter and producer Elsa Mickayla for a night of soulful melodies and heartfelt storytelling. Blending the warmth of R&B with the brightness of pop, Elsa takes the audience on a journey through her original music, including her 2024 releases—Memories, Say It to Me, and Changes. Expect lush vocal arrangements, stripped-down moments and a touch of Elsa’s a cappella roots from the award-winning vocal ensemble, The Island Voices. With her rich tone and emotive delivery, Elsa invites you into her world—where vulnerability meets groove, and every song leaves a lasting resonance.

title: Jamiel Said and The Troublemakers
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Get ready for an electrifying night with Jamiel Said and The Troublemakers taking the stage. Let loose and enjoy feel-good, rock and roll song covers arranged in their unique style. Influenced by the legends of rock, pop, ballads and alternative music, they perform songs from Ed Sheeran, Bruno Mars, The Script, The Weeknd, Sam Smith, Padi, NOAH, RAN, and more! Know friends who enjoy live music? Bring them along for an awesome, interactive show.

title: Loose Pages: In Case We Haven’t Met
synopsis:
Singaporean artist elysrei takes the stage with her soulful vocals, reimagining pop hits that have inspired her own journey of risk and reinvention.
  Expect an evening of original music and stripped-down takes on crowd favourites, including songs from Sara Bareilles, Alicia Keys and HUNTR/X.
  Like the loose diary pages from a friend you have not met yet, Loose Pages is intimate, familiar and heartfelt.

title: Silk Sessions
synopsis:
Experience your favourite pop hits in a whole new light with vocalist Haziqah Hashir and guitarist Syamim! Known for her warm, soulful voice, Haziqah brings a gentle, heartfelt take to songs by artists like Justin Bieber, Rihanna and Britney Spears.
  Enjoy the duo’s stripped-back R&B renditions of pop chart-toppers, that highlight the emotion behind the music. Syamim’s subtle playing complements Haziqah’s warm vocals, giving familiar tracks a quieter, more reflective feel. Together, they reimagine popular classics in a way that is personal, simple, honest and heartfelt.

title: The Lady Rara Show
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Get ready for an unforgettable night with The Jillets! This dynamic all-girl band brings vibrant energy, stellar musicianship and irresistible stage chemistry.
  Expect a concert packed with fan favourites, from timeless classics to today’s biggest top 40 hits, that will have everyone singing and dancing along. But that’s not all: the highlight of the evening will be a special tribute to Mother Monster herself, Lady Gaga.
  With big voices, playful banter and electrifying vibes, The Jillets promise a night of music, memories and pure celebration not to be missed.

title: An Evening with Gail Belmonte
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Look forward to a soulful and uplifting performance by Gail Belmonte—filled with heartfelt ballads, smooth grooves and radiant anthems! In a special tribute to Queen Bey, Gail reimagines some of Beyoncé’s greatest hits in fresh and emotional ways.
  BeyHive, get ready for a night of singing, dancing and all things Beyoncé. Who run the world?

title: Where’d All the Time Go?
synopsis: Come watch three siblings, Wirda, Wafiq and Walia, bring songs from their tiny bedrooms to the stage. Performing TikTok viral songs from the likes of Laufey and Coldplay to ABBA and the Goo Goo Dolls, look forward to a night of family harmonies, sibling banter and pure fun, as the trio performs together for the very first time (and hopefully not the last)! Growing up in a musical household has truly been a joy, and the siblings cannot wait to share their music and experience with everyone!

title: Memes, Streams & Dreams with Jarvis
synopsis:
Jarvis brings a unique blend of music and storytelling, tracing the soundtrack of the internet age. From global pop hits that became unforgettable memes, to the viral anthems born on TikTok, his performance promises to be both nostalgic and refreshingly current. Along the way, he reflects on how music itself has changed and how songs are written, shared and remembered in a world shaped by streaming and social media. As a songwriter, Jarvis offers a behind-the-scenes perspective that turns this set froma concert — into a conversation about the sound of our times.
  Don’t miss this evening of Memes, Streams and Dreams, in a vibrant performance that is both entertaining and insightful!

title: A Cappella Showcase: SIT & Ngee Ann Poly
organiser: SIT Just Singers, The Major Seven and NP Voices A Cappella (NPVA) (Singapore)
synopsis:
Pop and R&B fans are in for a treat with three special performances by local a cappella groups SIT Just Singers, The Major Seven and NP Voices A Cappella from Ngee Ann Polytechnic. Be mesmerised by their powerful vocals, soulful tunes, and gain a newfound appreciation for a cappella music.
  Join SIT Just Singers for an enchanting evening of classic and contemporary a cappella pieces. Enjoy soulful harmonies and timeless tunes sung from the heart by The Major Seven. Last but not the least, expect an intimate yet powerful performance by NP Voices A Cappella.

title: Songwriting for Hope – Hear Our Voices
organiser: Martina Ng, Neo Ming Wei and Gwen Lee
synopsis:
Join singer-songwriters and musicians Martina Ng, Neo Ming Wei and Gwen Lee as they perform heartfelt songs composed by youths from Singapore Girls’ Home who participated in Esplanade’s Songwriting for Hope programme, as well as some of their original works. Each song tells the story of a youth who dared to dream and hope, despite their challenges and fears.
  Songwriting for Hope is a community engagement programme organised by Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay, in partnership with Diamonds On The Street. The programme aims to provide youths at risk with the opportunity to express themselves creatively through the art of songwriting. Through a series of workshops, participants learn song crafting skills, with the aim of turning their unique stories into songs of hope.
  This performance will showcase a good mix of songs from the performers, as well as those written by at-risk youth. Be inspired by original compositions that remind audiences never to give up when life’s challenges get too great.

title: Homegrown to the World
organiser: LASALLE College of the Arts Musical Theatre
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: The BA (Hons) Musical Theatre programme at LASALLE College of the Arts proudly celebrates 20 years of excellence, reflecting on the programme’s enduring legacy of nurturing versatile, world-class musical theatre artists. This year’s showcase celebrates the diversity of musical theatre and its role in shaping community and identity, with a setlist that includes iconic Singaporean compositions by Dick Lee, as well as commercial and independent works.

title: A Cappella Showcase: Singapore Poly and Republic Poly
synopsis:
Get ready to sing, dance and feel the beat with SP Vocal Talents (Banditz & 6OUL)! This a capella group brings your favourite hits to life, so be blown away by their renditions of songs from artists like Pentatonix, Sara Bareilles, Queen, Little Mix, Corinne Bailey Rae, One Direction, and many more. Expect a high-energy performance filled with catchy tunes and soulful ballads that’ll leave you dancing in your seat!
  After that, Republic Rhapsody will take to the stage with an evening of intricate harmonies and dynamic vocal arrangements. Their performance will take audiences on a journey through a wide spectrum of genres, from high-energy pop and dance-pop to soulful R&B and heartfelt ballads. Look forward to their renditions of hits like Cake by the Ocean by DNCE and Rather Be by Clean Bandit. Join Republic Rhapsody for an unforgettable evening of a capella music!

title: Voices Originals: Ethel Yap Vol. 2
synopsis: Known for her heartfelt songs and intimate performances, watch Ethel Yap perform songs off her second album Ethel Yap Vol 2. The album charts her growth over the past 8 years from searching for identity and meaning in her twenties, to surviving postpartum anxiety and depression in her thirties. With her inimitable style and originally-written folk songs, Ethel’s latest album not only celebrates her artistry as a folk singer, but keeps things fresh with cinematic, pop and rock elements as she tells stories from her life through song. Enjoy an evening of honest lyrics, intimate performances and heartfelt storytelling with her music.

title: A Cappella Showcase: NUS, SMU and NTU
organiser: NUS Resonance, SMU ReVOIX and NTU FUGroove
synopsis:
NUS Resonance, SMU ReVOIX and NTU Harmonix's FUGroove will take to the stage and perform their very own a cappella sets!
  NUS Resonance
Versatile arrangements, soulful singing and melodious harmonies. That’s what audiences can look forward to at any performance by NUS Resonance. Experience the magic of this group as they cover Pop, Alternative and R&B hits – a cappella style.
  SMU ReVOIX
Prepare to be amazed by what the human voice can do. SMU ReVOIX invites you on a musical journey where the only instruments you’ll hear are the ones produced by their voices.
  NTU FUGroove
Join NTU Harmonix’s FUGroove (pronounced foo-groove) for an evening of nostalgia, soul and timeless classics reimagined in their own unique style of singing. Featuring soulful renditions of End of the Road by Boyz II Men, Creep by Radiohead, Walk Away by Kelly Clarkson and a Bruno Mars Medley, go on a journey of beloved classics that’ll leave you singing long after the last note fades.
  Listen to fresh a cappella renditions and harmonies of a wide variety of songs, featuring upbeat pop hits and iconic musical theatre numbers. If you know the tunes, be sure to sing along!

title: The Carnival
synopsis:
Hear iconic pieces brought to life by Eastside Story Productions, featuring selected works that explore the theme of fleeting time and childhood. Audiences can look forward to dynamic performances of well-known classics like Louis Spohr’s Sehnsucht & Wiegenlied, Paul Jenjean’s Carnival of Venice, Erich Wolfgang Korngold’s Songs of the Clown, and Stephen Sondheim’s Send in the Clowns.
  The set follows a narrative: A young girl drifts into a dream, where she wanders through a carnival filled with noise and colour, and pauses to listen to the strange, wistful songs of a clown. When she awakes, she realises that she is no longer a child. A woman looks into the mirror, confronting the passage of years and the seasons that have slipped away, and wonders how her youth has vanished.
  Act 1: Entering the Dream
Featuring Spohr’s Sehnsucht & Wiegenlied (Voice, Clarinet and Piano)
  Act 2: The Carnival
Featuring Jeanjean’s Carnival of Venice (Clarinet and Piano) and Korngold’s Songs of the Clown (Voice and Piano)
  Act 3: Waking Up
Featuring Sondheim’s Send in the Clowns (Voice, Clarinet, and Piano)

title: Voices Originals: 陳子健 ZJ
synopsis: 陳子健 ZJ will be performing a mix of original songs released over the years, including his latest single 《睡睡睡 Sleep³》, along with tracks he has written for other artists. Get ready to chill, hang out and vibe to feel-good tunes!

title: Bellingham: A Retro Singalong
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Bellingham invites you on a joyful journey through the golden age of music. From the swinging 60s to the electric 80s, audiences can look forward to renditions of timeless classics from The Beatles, ABBA, Carpenters, Neil Diamond, Toto, and more.
  Expect a lively, interactive experience featuring unforgettable hits like Dancing Queen, Sweet Caroline, Let It Be, Have You Ever Seen the Rain, and Country Roads. Delivering heartfelt vocals and rich harmonies, Bellingham brings the fun to the Esplanade with a feel-good performance that’ll have everyone singing along all night long!

title: Mandopop Group Vocal Jam
synopsis:
Join The Vibe Choir Singapore – the only Mandopop choir in Singapore – for a night of soulful community choir singing! In this session, participants will be able to sing their favourite Mandopop tunes and learn techniques for singing in harmony.
  Through the Vocal Jam programme, learn solo singing tips as well as group harmonisation techniques through Jay Chou's classic hit, 《简单爱》.
  Come sing along and vibe with The Vibe Choir Singapore!
  No audition is required.

title: Voices Originals: Leftover Stories 剩下的旋律
synopsis: Leftover Stories 剩下的旋律 is a stripped-down set by Singaporean Mandopop singer-songwriter 孫文琦 WENQI, featuring original songs that began as half-sung voice memos and unsent thoughts. Blending pop, ballads, and quiet chaos, this intimate performance explores heartbreak, growing pains, and the beauty of finally saying what you couldn’t before. Expect melodic honesty, lyrical attitude, and live renditions of some of her most personal works—including her breakout single 剩下的烟火 Fireworks Without You, which has garnered over 140,000 Spotify streams since its release in December 2023. If you’ve ever left something unsaid, this show speaks what your heart desires.

title: Liederabend – An Evening of Schumann's Art Songs
synopsis: Journey into the rich world of 19th-century German Romanticism, where poetry and music intertwine to reveal the depths of human emotion. At the heart of the program lies the lyricism of Heinrich Heine, whose verses capture both the tenderness and the torment of love. Robert Schumann’s Dichterliebe, Op. 48, stands as one of the most profound song cycles in the Romantic repertoire, embodying Heine’s bittersweet reflections on love with music of exquisite delicacy and intensity. Alongside it, Clara Schumann’s Sechs Lieder, Op. 13, reveals not only her distinct compositional voice but also her profound sensitivity to Heine’s poetic imagery. Together, these works are united in their shared devotion to both poetry and music.

title: Treasured Opera Arias Across Eras
organiser: Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts Vocal Department
synopsis:
Dive into the world of opera, and gain a deeper appreciation for this timeless artform across the centuries. Experience the enduring power of opera to inspire, and experience the spectrum of musical expression from the Baroque era to present day.
  Begin your journey in the expressive Baroque era with Handel’s Il trionfo del Tempo e del Disinganno. Then time travel to the Classical period and see how Mozart’s Die Zauberflöte and Don Giovanni combines profound human insight with wit and dramatic vitality. Witness how Donizetti’s L’Elisir d’Amore captures the charm and vulnerability of love. Finally, the night ends triumphantly with Jonathan Dove’s The Enchanted Pig, a humorous musical tale demonstrating how modern composers continue to creatively reinterpret timeless stories.

title: Choral Showcase: We Are The Graduate Singers
synopsis: Since 2010, The Graduate Singers (TGS) and their artistic director and conductor Adyll Hardy have made their mark on the international stage in the area of choral music. Returning to the Esplanade Concourse in celebration of their 15th anniversary, TGS will present an exciting set featuring crowd favourites and timeless classics.

title: A Botanical Christmas
synopsis: Enjoy A Botanical Christmas with Chroma – a choral ensemble specialising in Western classical vocal music. Audiences are in for a treat with a specially curated setlist of English a cappella choral music, inspired by flora, nature and art that pay tribute to the . Get ready for a night of Christmas carols you know and love by Ord, Vaughan Williams, and Rutter, plus traditional songs sung at Christmas time, including lesser performed carols by Gibbons, Joubert, Warlock, Rodney-Bennett, and Elizabeth Poston.

title: Choral Showcase: EVOKX
synopsis: Showcasing a curated repertoire, EVOKX’s one-night only performance highlights the complexities of human emotion, and the profound power that music has to heal. In celebration of the homegrown arts scene, this performance will extensively feature choral compositions from local composers. These include In the Heart of a Rose, She Walks in Beauty, and 是否(Shifou) from Singaporean composer Seow Mao Yu, and selected works from Singaporean composer Americ Goh. EVOKX’s music-making aims to touch hearts, create beauty and be a heartfelt representation of each member’s individual experiences and life journeys.

title: Voices Originals: Aaron Bunac Live
synopsis: Catch Pop and R&B singer Aaron Bunac live at the Esplanade Voices Festival 2025, performing songs from his debut album DATE NITE, including hits like The Best, Change Your Mind, Let Your Head Down and You Make Love Easy. With his signature feel-good sound and heartfelt vocals, prepare to be serenaded by Aaron Bunac as he sings the songs he loves – from the heart.

title: K-Pop Singalong with MOHANO
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: It’s K-pop karaoke night with MOHANO! Add some fun to your Saturday evening with a high–energy performance by quirky K-pop cover band MOHANO. Sing along to popular K-pop hits from KPop Demon Hunters, BTS, JENNIE, NewJeans, and more.

title: Choral Showcase: The Vocal Consort
synopsis: Prepare to be mesmerised by The Vocal Consort Singapore as they perform a beautiful medley of choral pieces for one night only. With breathtaking harmonies and impeccable vocal harmonisation, this concert promises to be an unforgettable experience for audiences of all ages. Discover the power and beauty of choral music at its finest!

title: Voices Originals: Dawn Yap 叶芷彤
synopsis:
Audiences can look forward to a cozy performance by singer-songwriter Dawn Yap 叶芷彤, featuring released and unreleased originals in both Mandarin and English. Her songs draw on personal experiences and stories, expressed through clear, honest songwriting that resonates with listeners from all walks of life. In addition to her originals, Dawn will perform fresh renditions of her favourite tunes, reflecting her journey through different genres of music. Her set highlights bilingual expression and musical versatility, offering audiences a direct and engaging showcase of her evolving sound and growing body of work.
  Accompanied by pianist Jordan Says.

title: Choral Showcase: Songs at Dawn
synopsis: From thunder to stillness, from prayer to flight, and a journey from the dramatic to the sublime, join Symphonia Choralis on a musical journey filled with thunderous moments, lyrical beauty and meditative stillness. Hear iconic pieces like Carl Orff’s O Fortuna, Victor Hugo’s I Dreamed A Dream, Anton Bruckner’s Ave Maria, Arvo Pärt's Solfeggio and Vaughan Williams’ The Lark Ascending – brought to life by the talented musicians and vocalists of Symphonia Choralis. Audiences are in for a surprise, with a guest appearance by a highly-acclaimed violinist and lots of opportunities to make music with the festival chorus.

title: A Musical Time Machine Singalong
organiser: Miss Rachel and the VOCA Singers
synopsis: A Musical Time Machine Singalong stars Miss Rachel and the VOCA Singers on an exhilarating journey through musical eras and genres. Get ready to sing-along to ABBA classics, 90s hit-makers Backstreet Boys, Taylor Swift’s chart-toppers and even the infectious tunes from the viral sensation KPop Demon Hunters. The show celebrates joy, creativity, and connection through music. The audience is invited to come dressed in an outfit from their favourite era, sing along and join Miss Rachel and the VOCA Singers on a truly exciting musical adventure.

title: Moon Musings
synopsis:
Watch The Sugar Bees debut original tunes like Man on the Moon, Maria and Variation of You.
  With a diverse repertoire spanning 1930s to contemporary music, audiences are in for a treat as The Sugar Bees perform classic vocal arrangements and soul music from The Clementi Soul Unit. Get ready for a stripped-down, intimate acoustic set from The Sugar Bees!

title: Voices Originals: belle, Shahz and Wen Fei
synopsis:
Singer-songwriter belle, Shahz and Wen Fei joined by Haziq (Cajonist) and Tony (Keys) are friends who enjoy making music together. They will share a heartfelt set of original songs that are a reflection on life, love, and everything they’ve experienced. With honest lyrics and melodies drawn from their personal lives , they invite listeners into a musical journey that is both intimate and relatable. 
  From soulful ballads to funky tunes, this performance captures the essence of storytelling through song — celebrating the voice as a powerful medium for emotion and connection. Join them for an evening of music that resonates long after the final note.

title: Majulah! A Celebration of Singapore Musical Theatre
synopsis:
Majulah Singapura! As SG60 comes to a close, Serious Arts Collective is coming together to commemorate iconic musicals that capture the Singaporean voice.  
  Actor-singers Ted Ngoo, Annika Mock and Seren Chen will bring musical numbers to life, accompanied by composer Jonathan Shin.
  Join us for a one night only performance and be dazzled by the stories that have captured so many hearts in our Little Red Dot!

title: Diva Night with The Vibes
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Bringing high energy and groovy tunes to the stage, The Vibes will perform your favourite classics and iconic tunes of every era. Dance the night away to songs from ABBA, Chaka Khan, Tina Turner, Whitney Houston, Beyoncé and many more. Featuring guest singer, Hanita with her powerful vocals!

title: Voices Originals: Evening Therapy with Marae
synopsis: Audiences can look forward to a riot of colour and a mind-blowing performance from Marae, a powerhouse vocalist belting all your favourite Pop and R&B hits. With unique takes on iconic tunes, get ready for an energetic performance by the one and only and Marae!

title: Tunes in Purple
synopsis:
Celebrate the Singapore spirit with works by local composers and arrangers in Tunes in Purple, specially commissioned for The Purple Symphony, Singapore’s largest inclusive orchestra. With its unique instrumentation and vibrant spirit, look forward to a fresh new way to experience music!
  Enjoy original pieces inspired by everyday sights and sounds, alongside medleys blending classical music, folk tunes and beloved Singapore melodies. Highlights include excerpts from Bizet’s Carmen Suite, a xinyao medley by Liang Wern Fook, and Singapore-inspired works such as Kreta Ayer and Fortitude by Liong Kit Yeng.

title: girlyPOP!
organiser: Bennett Bay, Claris Tan and Risa Ann Wong (Singapore)
synopsis: Join Bennett Bay, Claris Tan and Risa Ann Wong as they pay tribute to their favourite girlypop love songs from the past decade. Dance along to covers from artists like Olivia Rodrigo, Chappell Roan, Sabrina Carpenter and more!

title: Stripped Back: A Decade of Pop
synopsis:
Take a trip through the past decade with Anthea and Cheng, as they perform stripped-back versions of top hits filled with strength and resilience.
  Stay tuned for empowering anthems from the past ten years, as the duo covers hits from icons like Beyoncé, Miley Cyrus and Dua Lipa.
  This evening of intimate acoustics is all about raw energy, connection and emotion.

title: Soulful Journeys
synopsis:
Get ready for an unforgettable unplugged evening with Mazhai and Nilesh. They are bringing together soulful Tamil melodies like Maruvaarthai and Kadhaippoma, trending hits such as Oorum Blood and Vizhi Veekura, while weaving in a Hindi touch with Apna Bana Le and Kesariya.
  With raw, heartfelt vocals and acoustic arrangements, the duo promises an immersive experience that connects music lovers across languages. Whether you are here for nostalgia, trending favourites or simply the power of live music, this unplugged session will be a soulful journey not to be missed.

title: Wild for Winehouse: A Roseville Lens
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Join local band Roseville for a soulful night celebrating the unforgettable music of British pop icon Amy Winehouse! With a very special guest and dear friend on the keyboard, the evening promises fun, dancing, and her biggest and best-loved hits—including Valerie, Rehab and Back to Black. 
  Come ready to groove and let your hair down!

title: Song Signing 101 Workshop
organiser: The Singapore Association For The Deaf (SADeaf)
synopsis:
Get ready to feel the music and sign along. This hands-on workshop is open to everyone, no matter your background. You’ll learn basic sign language, how to express songs through movement and facial expressions, and discover how rhythm and gestures bring music to life. It’s a fun, welcoming space to connect, explore and express yourself.
  This programme is also presented as part of SG Enable’s Enabling Lives Festival.

title: KR Harmonica: Anime Reimagined
synopsis:
Join KR Harmonica for an evening of nostalgia and discovery as the ensemble brings iconic soundtracks from beloved anime series to life through the unexpected voice of the harmonica.
  From soaring cinematic themes to playful tunes, audiences can look forward to fresh arrangements of Tracing That Dream, Passion Continent, Merry-Go-Round of Life, Totoro Suite and Until the End of the World.
  As one of the few harmonica ensembles in Singapore, KR Harmonica blends tradition with innovation, exploring new possibilities for this niche yet captivating instrument. Expect a unique experience where familiar melodies are reimagined in harmonica and delivered with passion.

title: Karis & Jonelle
synopsis: From tear-jerking ballads to timeless anthems, join Karis and Jonelle for an evening of unforgettable music and memories. Featuring iconic Mandopop hits and beloved Chinese drama original soundtracks such as A Little Happiness《小幸运》 and Your Name Engraved Herein《刻在我心底的名字》, their soulful vocals and expressive keyboard arrangements will take you on a nostalgic journey through the songs that defined a generation.

title: Piano Realms: Anime & Game Soundscapes
synopsis: Step into a world where fantasy, adventure and emotion converge through the power of piano and its keys. This performance brings to life beloved soundtracks from Studio Ghibli’s timeless films, the cosmic journeys of Love and Deep Space, the sweeping landscapes of Genshin Impact and other iconic anime and gaming universes.

title: 《追剧·追声》 Soundtracks of Our Screens
synopsis:
Remember the nostalgic song 《如燕》 from the famed local TV drama, Little Nonya 《小娘惹》, the xinyao 新谣 songs from Crescendo 《起飞》 and the familiar 《雪落下的声音》 from Story of Yanxi Palace 《延禧攻略》?
  Look forward to lots of fun and laughter as the dynamic duo from local live band, Psquare 四方行, takes you through the songs they grew up with on TV dramas!

title: Showtunes with Sofie and Ryan
synopsis: Join musical theatre performer Sofie and guitarist Ryan Lai as they perform show tunes from hit musicals such as Wicked, Dear Evan Hansen and Hadestown. Let your inner musical theatre nerd out and sing along to familiar favourites or discover a new musical that you’d never heard about.

title: An Evening with Wirda Hanee
synopsis: Immerse yourself in a heartwarming evening of music and meaning as Wirda Hanee brings her acoustic soul to the stage. With heartfelt love songs, tender guitar melodies and stories woven with honesty and charm, this performance celebrates love in all its forms. Expect laughter, quiet moments and songs that feel like home—whether you're falling in love, healing or simply happy to be alive. An evening of connection, comfort and beautifully honest music awaits.

title: Thomson Swing Band - Big Band Soundtracks
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: For Big Band Soundtracks, the Thomson Swing band will perform big band music from movies of the past, such as It had to be you from When Harry met Sally (1989) and a few from more recent screenings.

title: Paraxel 2.0
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Join Paraxel 2.0 for an evening filled with the sounds of the big screen. The band takes on some of the most iconic movie soundtracks—from the power of Don’t Stop Me Now to the emotion of Skyfall and I Don’t Wanna Miss a Thing. Blending rock, pop, and cinematic tones, Paraxel 2.0 brings a fresh and heartfelt twist to songs everyone knows and loves. Expect thrilling performances, dynamic energy, and moments that’ll make you feel like you’re in your favourite film.

title: Name That TV Tune! With Shan & Luke
synopsis:
Put your TV knowledge to the test as Shan & Luke reimagine unforgettable soundtracks from across television history in this interactive show. Expect acoustic renditions of everything from classic sitcom themes to nostalgic teen favourites and the epic adventures of today’s streaming sensations.
  Covering decades of television, the duo transforms instantly recognisable soundtracks into fresh, stripped-down arrangements that highlight the music’s timeless appeal. With a blend of playful trivia, soulful harmonies and plenty of audience participation, Shan & Luke deliver a unique evening celebrating the shows we love and the songs that made them unforgettable.

title: Masala Meltdown
synopsis:
Join us for a fulfilling musical experience, brought to you by MusicMinds in collaboration with Esplanade, as part of Kalaa Utsavam 2025!
  We're thrilled to announce Masala Meltdown, a sensational showcase of enchanting Indian film music, in an intimate and unplugged setting at the Esplanade Upper Concourse.
  Mark your calendars for this musical revival and celebrate the resilience, artistry and joy of live music. Let’s create new memories and relive the great moments together. Join us for a night of music, laughter, and sheer euphoria!

title: Dil Se
synopsis: Get ready for a soul-stirring journey through the golden melodies of Bollywood as Harsha takes the stage at Kalaa Utsavam. From timeless romantic ballads to vibrant dance hits and heartfelt songs of longing, her captivating voice brings both classics and contemporary favourites to life. Sung mostly in Hindi, with a dash of Punjabi flair, this performance will awaken memories, stir emotions, and make you want to sway along. Whether you’re reliving cherished moments or discovering these iconic tunes anew, Harsha’s heartfelt renditions will leave you humming long after the night ends. A nostalgic musical treat awaits every Bollywood music lover.

title: Veena Sitar Jugalbandhi
organiser: Dr. Manjula Surendra, Susanta Chowdhury, Ramanan Thiruchittampalam & Supriyo Banerjee (Singapore)
synopsis:
Look forward to a luminous tribute to the musical genius and enduring legacy of Rabindranath Tagore—the Bard of Bengal.
  Through Rabindra Sangeet, a body of over 2,500 works shaped by his poetic vision, Tagore forged a profound dialogue with Indian classical traditions, including Saint Tyagaraja’s carnatic legacy. Deeply inspired by Tyagaraja’s devotional intensity, melodic structure and emotive ragas, he reimagined carnatic kritis, honouring their raga frameworks while infusing his own lyrical and philosophical sensibility. Tagore didn’t merely borrow; he reinterpreted them to suit Bengali aesthetics and his “religion of humanity,” preserving Tyagaraja’s spiritual depth while softening rhythmic complexity for broader accessibility.
  This performance is a cross-cultural homage to that genius: a radiant confluence of South Indian classical rigor with North Indian poetic nuance. Hear some of these inspirations come alive on veena and sitar, culminating in an original grand finale: a multi-raga jugalbandhi composed by Dr. Manjula Surendra.
  Don’t miss this celebration of devotion, artistry, and timeless resonance.

title: Film Vibes: Re-inKarnation’s Pan-Indian Musical Party
date:
28 Nov 2025, Fri, 7pm, 8.15pm & 9.30pm
View dates and time
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Get ready for a spectacular night where cinematic magic comes alive across five Indian languages, in one grand cross‑cultural concert under the stars, set against Singapore’s stunning skyline.
  This open-air concert by Team Re-inKarnation features three segments:  
Pyar Prema Kadhal, 7pm
Unplugged Under the Stars, 8.15pm
Bindaas Beats, 9.30pm 
  Featuring: 
Lead Vocals: Kaushik Suresh, Ganesh Venkataraman (Fame of Vijay TV Super Singer), Darshna Mahadevan, Lavanya Sampath 
Musicians: Jordan on keys, Kumaran on percussions, Ragha on flute, Sures on guitar, Venkatesh on violin, Joash on drums, Ganesh on cajon, Dhashini on bass 
Supporting Vocals/Guest Performers: Shivani Hariharan, Nandita Ramesh, Akshara Kaushik, Suhas Narendra Jagannathan, Guna
  From timeless melodies to high-energy chart-toppers, inviting listeners of all backgrounds are invited to sing, sway, and celebrate the vibrant spirit of Indian film music. Presented as part of Kalaa Utsavam’s mission to showcase regional diversity through the arts, Film Vibes: Re-inKarnation’s Pan-Indian Musical Party is a heartfelt tribute to the unifying power of music.

title: The Tapi Project
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
The Tapi Project revive and retell the stories of modern India through compelling songwriting and compositions that are simple and accessible. Their music spans folk, jazz, and rock, weaving in diverse influences. Some of their appearance highlights include Sessions, Windmills Craftworks, Abhivyakti Festival, the prestigious Mahindra Independence Rock Festival, and Spoken Fest. Following their 2024 single, Varsaad, a song celebrating the monsoons and featuring Raghu Dixit, the band released their soul-stirring new song Aa Gaye in May 2025, a first in what will form a two-part album rolling out this year.
  Fresh off their second UK tour this season with a prestigious showcase at the Celtic Connections in Glasgow, the band undertook a creative residency with London-based The Third Orchestra, alongside a series of workshops and performances, premiering their collaborative project The Third Eye with The Third Orchestra.

title: SHISHA TAPES
synopsis: The dynamic pairing of drummer and multi-instrumentalist Shamroz Khan and vocalist Sivaranjini Das return with an intimate yet powerful performance. Hailing from diverse musical backgrounds, the duo have produced two albums and touched hearts with hit singles such as Yetho, Tholaithooram, and The Aathichudi Movement. For this special performance, they join forces with their musician friends to reimagine their popular original compositions, blending rhythmic energy, evocative melodies, and a unique Singaporean spirit that resonates across cultures. Expect a night of connection, creativity, and unforgettable sounds.

title: Bollywood Blast 3
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Amit Dhamelia returns to Esplanade with Bollywood Blast 3 , presenting an electrifying showcase of Bollywood’s greatest hits. Audiences can expect everything from timeless, soulful melodies that stir the heart to explosive bassdrop dance numbers that get everyone moving. Amit-ji’s artistry and stage presence, combined with dazzling arrangements and rhythms, promise an evening that is both nostalgic and exhilarating. Known for his ability to connect with audiences across generations, Amit-ji transforms the stage into a celebration of sound, soul, and community. Arrive early, bring your family and friends, and revel in a night of Bollywood magic under the stars.

title: Fluteflix, Flute On Air!
synopsis:
Step into a night of nostalgia as we bring beloved TV drama theme songs—from Squid Game, Game of Thrones and The Little Nyonya—to life through the flute’s pure and vibrant sound. From touching ballads to joyful tunes, each melody will spark memories and emotions.
  And here’s the fun part—can you guess the show as the music begins? Whether you’re a drama enthusiast or simply a music lover, the thrill of recognising each theme song adds an extra spark to the experience, making it a night to remember.

title: Anime Hits with ARUHI アルヒ
synopsis: Rising local artist ARUHI アルヒ takes the stage for a relaxed evening, performing some of the most iconic and beloved anime hits. The performance features a mix of fan-favourite anime tracks and catchy J-pop hits, including Gurenge from Demon Slayer, Sparkle from Kimi no Na wa, Kaikai Kitan from Jujutsu Kaisen, and many more. It’s a must-attend night for anyone who loves anime and J-pop music!

title: Soundtrack of Our Hearts
synopsis:
Step back in time with Kenchana Trio, a soulful ensemble that brings to life beloved songs from Malay and Indonesian TV shows and movies.
  Led by Singapore’s very own crooner Rudy Djoe on vocals, joined by the expressive Mansoor Mohamed on piano and the dynamic Niq Osman on drums, the trio rekindles the warmth and nostalgia of tunes that once filled our living rooms and silver screens.
  Featuring classics such as Dedaun Masa (M. Nasir), Cinta Pertama (Anna Manthovani), and Pelangi Petang (Sudirman), this special showcase invites audiences to relive the golden era of storytelling—when every song carried emotion, memory and meaning.
  Let Kenchana Trio take you on a heartfelt musical journey through the songs that shaped generations—the true Soundtrack of Our Hearts.

title: <Joey Wee 黄绣惠 ～ Echoes of Time: A Journey Through Classic Film & TV Songs>
synopsis:
Joey Wee 黄绣惠 brings you a specially curated selection of classic songs from Hong Kong movies including favourites such as Chase《追》(in Cantonese). You will also enjoy a beautifully arranged medley featuring memorable tunes from local TV dramas (SBC/Mediacorp).
  Joey Wee 黄绣惠 will be performing alongside Daniel Ong on acoustic guitar, with Rei Lim on the baby grand piano for the evening. Together, they bring you an unforgettable evening of music, creating wonderful memories to share.

title: Midnight Tokyo LIVE
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Step into Midnight Tokyo with Crayon.MiX and embark on an inspired musical journey through live J-pop and anime songs. The set features trending One the Way (AiNA THE END, Dandadan), Yorushika, Tatsuya Kitani’s Where Our Blue Is (Jujutsu Kaisen) and iconic tracks by Kenshi Yonezu.
  From soaring melodies to dynamic rhythms, the band captures the vibrant energy of Tokyo, blending beloved anime themes with heartfelt and atmospheric J-pop favourites. Be transported into Tokyo’s neon-lit nights through captivating performances and the irresistibleenergy of Midnight Tokyo, brought to life by Crayon.MiX.

title: Brain Dance
synopsis: Hear the musical worlds of your favourite games performed live and be transported back to where legends began. Experience your beloved fantasy realms as they come to life on stage—from lightsabers and chocobos to neon-lit streets. Relive the most iconic moments from Star Wars, Final Fantasy, Cyberpunk 2077 and other immersive worlds.

title: Between the Lines and the Lyrics
synopsis: As the year draws to a close, Between the Lines and the Lyrics offers a thoughtful moment to pause and reflect on the many challenges and milestones we’ve faced. Through the emotional landscapes and storytelling power of musical theatre, we seek to understand the complexity of the past year. Each song becomes a lens to explore our shared experiences—highlighting resilience, hope and the human spirit amid adversity. Embark on a journey through the depth and nuance of stage music, reflecting on the past and anticipating what lies ahead.

title: Christmas with Lion City Brass Band
synopsis:
Celebrate the most wonderful time of the year with the Lion City Brass Band, led by Music Director Ignatius Wang. Usher in the Christmas cheer with an exhilarating evening of holiday favourites, virtuosic brass and familiar pop melodies.
  Enjoy heartwarming classics such as Away in a Manger and The Christmas Song popularised by The King Cole Trio, alongside the vibrant local composition Of Orchids and Crimson Sunbirds by Dax Wilson Liang.
  Gather family and friends for a radiant night of brass and festive spirit!

title: A Journey Through Sufi And Ghazal Mehfil
synopsis:
Immerse yourself in an enchanting evening of Sufi and ghazal melodies with three exceptional artists: Elliyas Farid, a soulful Singapore-born keyboardist and composer; Neeraj Saxena, a Hindustani classical vocalist known for his expressive and heartfelt renditions; and Gayetri Joshi, whose captivating voice adds depth and emotion to every performance. Together, they take audiences on a nostalgic musical journey through timeless classics by legendary icons such as Ghulam Ali, Pankaj Udhas, Jagjit Singh, and Noor Jehan, to name a few. Sufi and ghazal literature often intertwine, using rich metaphors to explore themes of love, loss and the quest for union with the divine.
  Ghazals began as a secular poetic form, later embraced by Sufi mystics, who adopted their structure to express spiritual concepts, creating a powerful tradition where the "beloved" can represent a human lover or God. Through intricate rhythms, soulful vocals, and evocative harmonies, this performance celebrates the poetic beauty and spiritual depth of Sufi and ghazal music. It is an evening where tradition meets emotion, and every note bridges the heart and the divine.

title: Essential
organiser: Raghavendran Rajasekaran and Lalit Kumar Ganesh (Singapore)
synopsis: Embark on an immersive journey where Indian classical flute meets the bold textures of experimental electronic music. Each composition weaves traditional ragas with modern synthesis, creating a vibrant dialogue between heritage and innovation. Expect deep, meditative moments that evolve into pulsating rhythmic layers, inspired by artists such as Talvin Singh, Nitin Sawhney, and Jon Hopkins. The set features original works exploring ragas including Bhairavi and Charukesi, offering a unique sonic experience that melds ancient melodies with contemporary sound design.

title: Finding Home
organiser: Chen Zibi, Soh Wen Qi and Jeremy Chiew (Singapore)
synopsis: An intimate recital featuring soprano, violin and piano, Finding Home reflects on the places, people and memories that shape a sense of belonging. Through lyrical works such as Misty and A Nightingale Sang in Berkeley Square, trace the tenderness, nostalgia and quiet beauty of what it means to find—or long for—home.

title: Sing With Us: Mandopop Memories
synopsis: Tien Yao and Zee first met through a singing competition, bonding over their shared love for Mandopop classics from the ’80s to the 2000s. This dynamic duo brings timeless hits from artists like Jay Chou, Shino Lin Xiao Pei, Stefanie Sun, and more! Get ready to sing along to favourite tunes and relive the golden era of Mandopop!

title: An Acoustic Christmas with Gabriel
synopsis: Step into the warmth of the season with Gabriel’s Acoustic Christmas—in a soulful evening of classic and modern Christmas tunes reimagined. From smooth jazz to R&B grooves and folk-inspired melodies, Gabriel brings the feeling of a white Christmas to sunny Singapore. Experience heartfelt renditions that capture both nostalgia and fresh charm, perfect for an evening spent with loved ones.

title: Christmas Jazz with Vanessa Shavonne and Friends
synopsis: Join Vanessa Shavonne and her band for a heartwarming evening of jazz and Christmas classics at Esplanade. With her velvety vocals and elegant swing, Vanessa breathes new life into beloved tunes like Winter Wonderland, Let It Snow and The Christmas Song. Backed by a stellar band, her performance blends classic jazz charm with the magic and intimacy of the festive season. Expect soulful improvisations, cosy nostalgia and moments that sparkle with warmth and joy—the perfect way to celebrate the holiday season with style and soul.

title: Made in Heaven: The Music of Queen
synopsis:
Made in Heaven: The Music of Queen is an acoustic exploration through the music of one of the greatest rock bands in history—Queen.
  Featuring powerful live performances of Queen’s iconic hits, Replug takes audiences on a journey through the band’s legendary career, bringing to life the musicality, theatrical brilliance and passion that have captured hearts worldwide.
  More than just a tribute, this is a heartfelt salute to the artistry and legacy of Freddie Mercury, Brian May, Roger Taylor, and John Deacon—a reminder of why Queen’s music continues to inspire generations around the world.

title: Isnina
synopsis:
After a five-year hiatus, Isnina returns to the stage to reconnect with both longtime fans and new listeners. As life for her has evolved, so has her music and her sound. This isn’t just a performance—it’s a celebration of resilience, growth and passion.
  Together with Haqilah on guitar, Syafiqah on bass, Jamal on cajon and guest singer, Hazizi, the audience can expect a blend of Isnina’s beloved classics such as Buaya and covers that the crowd can sing along to. Look forward to an unforgettable evening of raw emotion and electrifying energy with Isnina and friends.

title: Ayuh Kita Terbang!
synopsis:
Ayuh Kita Terbang! with Jack MataXatu alongside Juraimi Johari, Amin Abd Rahman and Rudee Oma, invites audiences to celebrate new hope, good vibes and reunions as 2025 makes way for 2026.
  Set in an acoustic and lepak atmosphere, Tour Bunker will perform a few of its originals including Tak Mengapa, Ada Masanya and Terbang, along with nostalgic covers from M.Nasir, Ebiet G.Ade and Iwan Fals. Get ready for a night of singalongs and favourites that everyone knows.

title: Soundbites: A Bite of Christmas Magic
synopsis: Christmas music meets a cappella as Soundbites presents their fresh take on well-loved holiday tunes. From classic carols to radio-friendly pop hits, their harmonies will bring warmth, joy and festive cheer to the most wonderful time of the year!

title: Songs of Freedom and Joy
synopsis: Harmony and Light brings together choral highlights from Mozart’s The Magic Flute and selections from the heartrending Les Misérables in a performance celebrating the human voice in its purest form. Through music of wonder, hope and compassion, the chorus journeys from the realms of opera to the modern stage, uniting diverse styles in radiant harmony.

title: Kavya & Max (Joy Alexis)
synopsis: Enjoy an evening of music that truly moves the soul. Join the duo Kayva and Max, as they share the stage, covering music close to their hearts. Neo-soul songs by artists Raveena and Nai Palm of Hiatus Kaiyote might stir the soul and inspire movement, while indie-alternative folk by artist Madison Cunningham may bring tears. Expect pop tunes by pop star Chappell Roan and Christmas classics from Nat King Cole and Bing Crosby.

title: Songs We Bring
synopsis: The holidays are a time for coming together—and for The Straits Collective, that means connecting through music. Songs We Bring is a musical gathering where friends, both old and new, share tunes rooted in diverse inspirations, taking turns to lead and listen. Set against the festive backdrop of the season, the performance celebrates collaboration, togetherness and the joy of discovery through sound.

title: The Songs We Grew Up Singing
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Richie El reunites with his friends for a special evening of music, celebrating cherished memories and new beginnings. From songs they grew up jamming to in dusty rehearsal studios to the tunes that shaped their journey as musicians, the group brings these precious favourites to the stage—this time against the backdrop of the Singapore skyline. Don’t miss an evening of heartfelt stories, sing-along melodies and a chance to relive the joy of music that connects people across time.

title: Memory Lane
synopsis: Join P. Jasper for an intimate and heartfelt evening filled with nostalgia and storytelling. Through songs rooted in friendship, resilience and life’s bittersweet moments, Jasper invites audiences to feel the warmth of shared vulnerability and connection. His performance blends acoustic tunes from artists like Ed Sheeran, with soulful indie-folk sounds and touching originals that speak straight from the heart. Each song unfolds a chapter of life’s journey, capturing laughter, loss and love in its rawest form. Come and experience a night where music evokes memory, and every note brings the audience closer to stories shared.

title: Songs with Wayne
synopsis: Wayne Sandz returns to the stage for an evening of familiar favourites, blending pop and rock with his trademark charisma. From soaring ballads to soulful anthems, his heartfelt interpretations bring a fresh warmth to songs audiences know and love. With smooth vocals and captivating stage presence, join Wayne for a performance that is both intimate and uplifting—a chance to pause, reflect and celebrate the joy of live music as the year comes to a close. Don’t miss this special evening, as the music ushers in a brand new year!

title: You’ve got a friend
synopsis: Join Vanessa and friends for a heartfelt (and slightly chaotic) musical love letter to friendship—the ride-or-dies, the wild cards, the ones who drifted away, and everyone in between. Through a mix of pop old and new, as well as musical showtunes, they celebrate the people who colour life with laughter, nostalgia and the occasional splash of drama. Expect soulful harmonies, cheeky banter and songs that celebrate why people truly come together—to find a little piece of love in every friend.

title: The Jukuleles
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Join The Jukuleles as they make their return to Esplanade with chart toppers as well as their signature mashups of songs that will get everyone grooving and dancing.

title: owellciao & friends
synopsis: Sing along to timeless Christmas classics and owellciao’s heartfelt originals, made even better by surprise guests who are known and loved by many. Soak in the festive joy with loved ones and close friends, and celebrate an evening filled with warmth, togetherness and festive joy for all ages.

title: 12 Degrees of Christmas with Third Degree
synopsis:
Third Degree makes their long-awaited return to the Esplanade stage with two dazzling nights of Christmas splendour. The powerhouse trio of Owen, Ilina and Perry will revive beloved audience favourites from their extensive Christmas catalogue while debuting glittering new festive arrangements!
  Get ready for more of their signature three-part harmony, with joyful holiday favourites reimagined in stunning new arrangements. From timeless classics to contemporary hits, expect an evening of soulful twists, sparkling energy and a festive atmosphere that is sure to have everyone singing along from start to finish.

title: Hair of the Dog: Hangover Bangers
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Nurse that holiday hangover and keep the festivities going with Risa and RENE! They will be performing RENE’s original songs including Same for Me and Apocalypse!!!, alongside global hits like Chappell Roan’s The Subway and Hoobastank’s The Reason.

title: Senyum Mu Kenangan Ku
synopsis: Cosy up with Rico Setiabudi for an evening of warm and uplifting indie-pop acoustics, featuring singer-songwriter Ahmadul Amin. Joined by Kazhendra from Comic Strip and Kippy from Nadi Singapura, enjoy a setlist of original songs and selected covers from their favourite artists. Get ready for a dynamic collaboration that brings top-tier sound and an engaging evening on stage.

title: old leafs, new leafs – with jupiterkid & friends
synopsis: Celebrate the year that has come and gone with jupiterkid & friends in an evening of smooth melodies and soundscapes, as they commemorate and reflect on the highs and lows of the past year. From tender folk songs to sultry R&B and vibrant pop tracks that will get everyone up on their feet, end the year on a high note with a night of celebration, reflection and the promise of what is to come!

title: On The Edge
synopsis:
A tabla player and a classical pianist walk into a room. The start of a joke maybe, but in the case of TANSHIN, it was the beginning of a multi-year journey of orchestral co-commissions, ensemble collaborations and unfiltered jams into the wee hours.
  With influences like Goat Rodeo Sessions, Lili Boulanger, Ichiko Aoba, The Gloaming, and Florence + The Machine, the duo’s inspirations are as varied as their vocabulary. Tan and Shin make their debut collaborative performance as they present their improvisations and compositions in a set where genres and styles collapse into a singularity.

title: Belaian Sayang: Love, Through the Years
synopsis:
Come together as Alunan Kampung Gelam reimagines vintage songs from the Nusantara that speak of the passages of life and love. Belaian Sayang: Love, Through the Years celebrates the timeless bonds that connect family and community. Through these heartfelt songs, they honour the love of their elders—a love that deepens and endures across generations.
  For this performance, they are joined by Li Jiaqi and Riduan Zalani.

title: Ask Auntie the Musical
synopsis: Three strangers, each with their own (imagined or real) problems, find themselves kindred spirits this festive season as the last patrons left of a 24-hour kopitiam. Their favourite kopi auntie helps to solve their issues, one dazzling song at a time. Expect laughs, maybe some tears, and plenty of surprises as Les Musicables improvise songs and stories inspired by suggestions from the audience, with all-original music made up entirely on the spot.

title: Past, Present & Tomorrow
synopsis:
Ryzall Noh takes the audience on a musical journey through his roots, present‑day artistry and a glimpse into his future sound.
  Blending rock energy, heartfelt ballads and intimate storytelling, Ryzall Noh delivers a performance that is both nostalgic and forward‑looking.

title: Songs We Share
organiser: Bendemeer Secondary School Choir and The Joyful Voices (Singapore)
synopsis: Songs We Share brings together voices across generations in a heartwarming collaboration between Bendemeer Secondary School Choir and The Joyful Voices. Through familiar melodies such as Kit Chan’s Come Back When It’s Cold Outside《天冷就回来》, Fly Me to the Moon and other holiday favourites, the choirs celebrate music’s timeless power to connect hearts, cultures and communities.

title: Singapura LIVE! & Singa Maksima x Locals Only!
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Celebrate the heartbeat of Singapore’s music scene with Singapura LIVE! & Singa Maksima x Locals Only! Organised by Mediacorp, this much awaited event unites generations of homegrown talents in one unforgettable night of rhythm, soul and pure local pride.
  Feel the energy, hear the hits and be swept away by a powerful mix of solo performances and cross-generational collaborations—from iconic singers who have defined the Singapore sound, to trailblazers making waves beyond shores and rising stars dominating today’s social platforms.
  This electrifying showcase features a stellar line-up including Thaqif, Rahila Rashun, The Street Therapist, The Pinholes, Bushmen, and Bloco Singapura, each bringing their unique flair and unstoppable energy to the stage. It’s more than a concert—it’s a movement that celebrates local music, creativity, and connection.

title: A Novo Christmas
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Novo Winds brings festive sparkle with their joyful renditions of Christmas favourites, from contemporary hits like Mariah Carey’s All I Want for Christmas Is You, to timeless classics such as the jolly Winter Wonderland and the sultry Santa Baby.
  Be whisked away into a world of holiday cheer with an enchanting evening under the stars, filled with laughter, warmth and music that captures the true spirit of Christmas. Gather family and friends and don’t miss this magical celebration by the bay!

title: A Jazzy Christmas with the Amanda Lee Swingtet
synopsis:
Inspired by the classic jazz sounds of the 1930’s and ’40s, the Amanda Lee Swingtet present their unique takes on holiday classics, including their fresh bebop renditions of Frosty the Snowman and Santa Claus is Coming to Town.
  Piano and Vocals: Amanda Lee
Trombone: Leo Jeoh
Saxophone: Justin Ng

title: Mathilda & the Motherfunkys
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Spend Christmas with Singapore Idol finalist Mathilda D’Silva and her band Mathilda & the Motherfunkys!

title: When the Condor Meets the Garuda – A Sacred Wind Journey
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
The Garuda of Indian mythology and the condor of Native American tradition are sacred sky beings—messengers connecting earth and divine. Their songs and spirits travelled across ancient winds, echoing humanity’s shared spiritual kinship.
  Native South American ensemble SISAY and creative force Brahmastra come together in a transcendent musical collaboration, uniting the ancient continents of South America and India through the harmony of their sacred sound—the condor and the Garuda. Utilising native wind instruments, ancestral chants and traditional melodies, this performance bridges myth and history, reigniting the spiritual connection once shared when these lands were part of the supercontinent Gondwana. Witness a vibrant dialogue of music styles, rhythms, performances, and communication, where Native American and Asian sounds intertwine to reveal the unity within human diversity.

title: Countdown to 2026
organiser: Hey Pelican!, Heema Izzati and Amni Musfirah (Singapore)
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Fresh pop grooves, old school hits and everything in between. As the clock ticks toward midnight, get ready to party at the Outdoor Theatre with a celebration as big as the year ahead! Hey Pelican! kicks off the night with classic favourites from the ’60s to ’80s, Amni Musfirah takes it up a notch with powerhouse anthems from the ’90s and 2000s and Heema Izzati brings the house down with today’s chart-toppers. Sing, dance and celebrate as generations of music come together under the sparkle of Marina Bay’s fireworks—the perfect soundtrack to ring in the New Year!

title: Singapore Police Force Band CENTENNIAL GALA
synopsis:
Since sounding its first note as the 2nd Straits Settlement Police Band in 1925, the Singapore Police Force (SPF) Band has grown from strength to strength. From a modest military band, it has evolved into a world-renowned band with multiple distinct groups that create a vibrant musical force, continuing to inspire and engage audiences today.
  In celebration of the Singapore Police Force Band CENTENNIAL GALA, this concert presents a specially curated selection of the Band's most beloved and iconic pieces from across the decades. With its theme "Bringing the Beat to You Since 1925", the programme spans from Western classical works such as Shostakovich's Festive Overture, to original arrangements and compositions by current and past SPF Band officers, some of which feature ethnic instruments.
  The grand celebration sees the SPF Band, comprising its various ensembles including the Women Police Pipes and Drums (WPPD), elevated through partnership with the Gurkha Contingent Pipes and Drums Platoon (GCPD). Highlights for the evening include an item by vocalist and SPF Band former PNSman Taufik Batisah, as well as a showcase by the SPF Band's very own talented officer who will be performing seven different instruments.
  Join the SPF Band as they mark their momentous centennial milestone and experience a century of musical legacy!

title: Rock Through the Ages!
synopsis:
Rock Through the Ages! kicks off 2026 with an electrifying celebration of legendary rock music, reimagined for the symphonic stage.
  Look forward to the iconic sound of Queen, the soulful artistry of Eric Clapton, the timeless charm of Elvis Presley, and a powerful tribute to Aerosmith. Each feature pays homage to the eras and artists that shaped rock history, brought together in a dynamic showcase for all ages.
  This unforgettable concert promises an exciting start to the year, as classic anthems and beloved hits come alive on stage once again—a thrilling experience for every rock music fan!

title: Christmas Eve with Hillary Francis
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Kick off the festivities in style with entertainer extraordinaire Hillary Francis! He will charm audiences with timeless hits in multiple languages, well-loved original songs and sparkling Christmas classics. Don't miss this warm and joyful performance that is sure to be a delight for all ages.

title: [CANCELLED] Mathilda & the Motherfunkys
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Spend Christmas with Singapore Idol finalist Mathilda D’Silva and her band Mathilda & the Motherfunkys!

title: [UPDATED] Mathilda & the Motherfunkys
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Spend Christmas with Singapore Idol finalist Mathilda D’Silva and her band Mathilda & the Motherfunkys!

title: Narysal
synopsis: Narysal will bring his original and tease some unreleased music, not forgetting his hit single Fade Away (which garnered over 2,200,000 streams to date) and as well as many R&B hits and classics to kick off 2026.

title: Iman’s League
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Iman’s League, a melodic punk rock band formed in 2007, has grown into one of Singapore’s long-running bands, known for their energetic performances across Asia, Europe and Australia. With eight EPs and albums under their belt, they released their latest record, Where Do We Go From Here?,  an EP that reflects on their journey and questions what the next step should be after 17 years in the scene.

title: Bear The Remedy
synopsis:
Bear The Remedy will present stripped-down renditions of songs from their upcoming album, offering intimate, spine-tingling performances that reveal the heartbeat of each track—raw emotion, nuanced dynamics and unexpected musical turns.
  The set will feature entirely original pieces, exploring themes of growing pains and adulting in Singapore, expressed through an alternative rock sound. Live synth textures and ambient layers, creating atmospheric backdrops that deepen the mood and contrast with the rock band arrangement. Expect punchy riffs, moody atmospheres, soaring choruses and intricate textures delivered with conviction.

title: xena giam and friends
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: A new vibe, something a little more close to the heart and more intimate, even with a big setting. xena giam and friends will be playing songs like Longest Time, of course, as well as the collaboration pieces with Sun Cell, forever but never, and June.

title: Sio Sings Songs on a Saturday
synopsis:
Sio will perform her self-written songs alongside familiar favourites. Expect emotional, raw vocals that are sure to touch the hearts of the audience. She will present two sides of herself: Sio Lubis, the singer, and Nu Soibah, the regular 27-year-old awkward lady.
  Her setlist includes her original songs Seem Better and if I die tonight, as well as All I Want by Kodaline and The One That Got Away. Be prepared with tissue, in case a few tears are shed. Connect with Sio on a lovely Saturday.

title: Tides
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Step into Tides, the upcoming two-part EP shaped by the rise and fall of the ocean tide. Let Namie and the Waves take you through varying emotional intensities—from quiet reflection to uplifting momentum. Rooted in jazz and tinted with modern textures and experimental touch, the band brings a fresh, evolving sound to the stage.
  This performance features four soon-to-be-released tracks they’ve lovingly crafted over the years: Petrichor, Breeze, All at Once, and Letters from Day 1. These new works will flow alongside reimagined standards and modern tunes, as well as releases from Undercurrents, into the vast ocean of sound.

title: Mors Fortuita
synopsis: Step into the raw, emotional world of V4L at the Esplanade Concourse, where haunting melodies meet gut-wrenching vocals. As a singer-songwriter, V4L channels the depths of mental health struggles, loss and the echoes of past hardship into each performance, transforming pain into music that resonates. His acoustic soundscape weaves fragility and intensity, drawing on the textures of folk and emo. From originals to nostalgic covers, his sound ranges from delicate whispers to intense, visceral crescendos, each note echoing vulnerability and resilience. Experience a performance that is as intimate as it is unflinching—where emotion is laid bare.

title: Redwan Hamzah
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Redwan Hamzah brings a charged, genre-bending set, performing songs from his debut album Leaves and Children.
  Blending alternative rock grit with experimental sound design and raw emotional intensity, and joined by an incredible live band, his music shifts from quiet confession to bursts of fuzzed-out guitar and driving rhythm, tracing a path through memory, identity, and the chaos of our times.
  With a stage presence that is both vulnerable and commanding, Redwan transforms personal narrative into a kinetic live experience. Expect distortion, heart, and sonic catharsis—a performance that hits hard and lingers deep.

title: Create your “blueprint” with Shohini
synopsis:
Vibe with emerging pop singer-songwriter Shohini in an intimate evening of stories, reflection and original music.
  She will perform stripped-down arrangements of her latest single, blueprint along with older favourites and upcoming unreleased originals, while guiding you to create your own blueprint for life. It’s a journey to discover what you wish to keep, change and let go to build a life of joy.
  Shohini brings a fresh take to all things wholesome with her soulful vocals spiced with a never-say-die attitude. Expect a good time with friends and perhaps the occasional a tear or two.

title: all the words left unsaid
synopsis: With acoustic renditions of his recently released album all the words left unsaid, enjoy a recount of love, heartbreak, and self-discovery. Fall into an intimate space where every note and lyric tells a story, blending introspective originals with heartfelt melodies that linger long after the last chord fades.

title: sleep, oh dreamer
synopsis:
What is the sound of flickering dreams? They are never lost, only found. In this way, dreams make all things new. Join the first gathering of dreamers in the new year with paper and noma, as she sings in allegories of the human soul. 
  time has come 
dreamer, I know 
you have seen things

title: ULTRA MEGA CAT ATTACK: THE FUTURE IS (ALMOST) MEOW – A Sneak Purrview
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
ULTRA MEGA CAT ATTACK storms the stage with a wild mix of old favourites and brand-new chaos!
  Expect heavy riffs, fuzzy synths, booming drums, and future-rock anthems delivered with velvety, playful vocals from indie-rock sweetheart Codie (Codecaud, Haldi Honey).
  Be among the first to hear teasers from their upcoming single and EP, and get ready to laugh, jump, and maybe even adopt a cat!

title: Says It All: Unplugged
synopsis: Spend an evening with Says It All at their debut show, as the band brings their pop-punk anthems to life in an intimate, stripped-down acoustic set. Cash Christopher and Harith Shah take you through a heartfelt journey through their songs, sung in the key of emo. Whether it’s a love you can’t forget or one you’ve yet to meet, Says It All charms their way into your emo pop-punk playlists. This special performance invites you to slow down, lean in and savour the nostalgia with them.

title: Noah Corolla: Poppy Hill EP Release
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Noah Corolla returns to celebrate the release of his debut EP, Poppy Hill.
  Through reimagined arrangements, the show expands the world of Poppy Hill, bringing its songs to life and capturing its poignant moments.
  He will be joined on stage by a live band featuring Joshua Chan, Russell Goh and Shawn Chan.

title: Ahmadul Amin
synopsis: Ahmadul Amin brings an unfiltered performance, featuring new songs alongside covers of his favourite singer-songwriter tracks. Each show offers a genuine glimpse of Amin as a person—no act, no persona—making every performance a heartfelt and truly intimate experience.

title: Gruv Syndic8
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
From Bad Company to RATM, Gruv Syndic8 fuses musical expertise into an unforgettable experience. A showcase of sturdy tight rhythm section from seasoned musos Casey and Nazreen, classy fretboard work from local guitar wizard Paul Danial and the vocals of today’s rock standout, Kael.
  Catch Gruv Syndic8 for an evening of bangers unique renditions.

title: Between Us
synopsis: Between Us presents a fresh set of songs that captures Jason Yu’s latest artistic growth, offering an authentic, stripped-back glimpse of where his writing is headed and inviting the audience to be the first to hear the new stories he has been waiting to tell.

title: A Little Bit More with Masha Nyanna & More People
synopsis:
Making her Esplanade debut, Masha Nyanna invites you into an indie-pop evening shaped by honesty, warmth, and storytelling. Performing original songs about growing up, heartbreak and the quiet moments in between, she is joined by fellow singer-songwriter charms, whose dreamy beabadoobee-inspired sound adds a shimmering contrast, and guitarist Syafiq Gunawi, whose tender funk tones are sure to get you grooving.
  The evening features new, unreleased material, reimagined versions of Masha’s earlier works, and special covers from artists such as Paramore, Phum Viphurit, and more. Come for a gentle, intimate night of music—and leave wanting just a little bit more.

title: Bing Chilling 2.0 With ICEBOX
synopsis: 21-year-old singer-songwriter ICEBOX is reimagined and ready to move you. This sophomore performance invites you into his world, featuring beloved originals, intimate covers of the songs that shaped him and a peek into what's next. Whether you are just discovering ICEBOX or you have been here from the start, witness a talented, influential rising artist who has grown into his voice. With fresh arrangements and raw emotion, this performance will take you on a journey through heartbreak and growth—from past and present into the future—a chill evening with cool, cooler, ICEBOX.

title: A Night with Absence!
synopsis: Absence! ushers in a new chapter with their latest EP—an intimate blend of shimmering alt-pop, confessional lyricism and retro-tinged warmth. The band brings their new era to life with honest storytelling and addictive hooks, alongside reimagined favourites and unreleased material.

title: Vibes & Verses
synopsis: Step into the world of Angel Vaishilee, where music meets emotion and every note tells a story. Enjoy a captivating mix of her songs, including the premiere of a brand-new release, alongside heartfelt pop and R&B covers that showcase her versatile, soulful voice. From intimate ballads to vibrant grooves, each performance takes the audience on a journey of transformation, passion and connection. Whether singing along to familiar hits or discovering fresh originals, this show promises a memorable celebration of music, emotion and the beauty of new beginnings.

title: Riqqo Ft Azzy, Mudface
synopsis: Riqqo brings a fresh Trapsoul and R&B sound to Singapore, blending atmospheric production with smooth vocals and emotional storytelling. His performance will feature reinterpretations of songs by artists such as The Weekend and Tory Lanez, delivered with his own distinctive tone and style. Original tracks will also showcase his artistry, vulnerability and evolving sound. Through soulful melodies and heartfelt lyrics, Riqqo invites listeners into his world, creating an intimate and immersive experience that highlights the depth and versatility of modern R&B.

title: Pretty Reasonable Crashout
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Dominic Chin will perform new R&B, pop and soul songs from his upcoming album, PRETTY PETTY, set for releasein March 2026.
  He will also cover a selection of songs, including Don't Know Why by Norah Jones and Vanish into You from Lady Gaga’s album.

title: Entering the Dragon’s Lair
synopsis: Hidemen return with a sonically diverse 10-track album titled DRAGON, brings vibrant energy, and down-to-earth tracks that encapsulate the album’s world. Drawing inspiration from medieval role-playing themed games such as Dungeons & Dragons, and Baldur’s Gate 3, the group channels the essence of storytelling, expressing themselves through unconventional means. Lyrically, Hidemen explores themes of a brighter yet unpredictable future, embracing amotion amid uncertainty (Elixir). Sonically, they blend storytelling and world-building with a seamless fusion of genres, pushing the boundaries of hip-hop.

title: 20 Smooth Jazz Hits with Inkblot Page
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Classifying themselves as an egg-punk band with avant-garde no wave influences, Inkblot Page is a brand-new band that debuted in November 2024. Despite being so new, the band members are industry veterans, having played in other bands such as Subsonic Eye, Krunkle, Intermission and more. Their live shows often feature extensive improvisation, with the band members and audience embarking on a journey together, never knowing exactly where it will lead.

title: The Daydreamer
synopsis:
Snow-capped mountains march toward the floating ocean, forging a path of their own making, while vast green fields shift aside. They long to finally bathe in those glistening waters, where they once spent their youth. Soon, they pass a lonely hill, unmoved by the world’s changes. There on the hill sits The Daydreamer who thirsts for all the colours of the world.
  In this performance, Bennett explores various sonic worlds using live looping, along with acoustic and electric guitar, piano and a range of software instruments.

title: rhyu
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Singaporean singer-songwriter rhyu returns to perform heartfelt renditions of her original songs including Melt, It’s fine and For it’s You and Me. Her music captures memories and emotions brought to life, and she hopes it can offer listeners the same comfort it brings her.

title: The Art of Vulnerability
synopsis: MURPHY opens his heart, showing the beauty of vulnerability through his music. Addressing everyone going through challenges, he shares his journey as listeners navigate life alongside him together. In addition to his originals, he performs covers of artists who currently inspire him, including OneRepublic, Lewis Capaldi and Zack Tabudlo. From singalongs to deeply emotional ballads, his set offers something for everyone.

title: Polymers
synopsis: Inspired by traditional ensembles, Polymers fuses funk and Indian music into a fresh, contemporary sound. The band explores bold rhythmic ideas, colourful melodic textures and dynamic grooves, creating music that is both rooted and experimental. By blending Carnatic influences with modern ensemble playing, Polymers push genre boundaries while keeping their energy sharp and distinctive. Their performances bring together the band’s shared drive to experiment, evolve and create something new.

title: Modern Nostalgia
synopsis: A night with DLKC promises nostalgic indiepop and pop rock. The band will perform new songs from the upcoming album, including California Nights and Take Me Back, evoking those feelings, alongside covers of recent releases by 2000s-inspired artists such as The Jonas Brothers and All Time Low.

title: chero
synopsis: chero, known for sharing her personal experiences through her songs, presents a heartfelt acoustic performance. She will perform songs by her favourite artists while sharing stories from her life, offering laidback, intimate renditions of tracks by Billie Eilish, Lewis Capaldi, Taylor Swift, and more.

title: Rose Tinted Press
synopsis: Rose Tinted Press brings their signature warmth and wonder to the stage, weaving story-rich songs into an enchanting folk-pop set. With lush fingerstyle playing on six- and 12-string guitars and whimsical vocal harmonies, they reimagine favourites by artists like Sufjan Stevens and The Oh Hellos, alongside their own heartfelt originals.

title: Riddim & Rhymes
organiser: Amir Mansor, ARDY, Flique Mohamad and Nurhakeem (Singapore)
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: A vibrant, feel-good blend of reggae and hip-hop energises the stage, with live improvisation and smooth rhythmic grooves. The set features Bob Marley classics, unique reggae-styled renditions of popular Indo-pop songs and original material with progressive reggae and hip-hop influences. Uplifting vibes, infectious rhythms and spontaneous moments make each performance one-of-a-kind.
