title: Fresh Bakes from Space
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Home grown indie rock band Bakers in Space return to the stage three years after their release of their sophomore EP MAGMA to perform brand-new songs from their upcoming album. The new songs feature more vocals and guitars, drawing inspiration from artists such as Wilco, Mac Demarco, The Strokes and more. This marks a departure from the darker, heavier tones of MAGMA, offering an evolved and matured sound reminiscent of their earlier tracks like Autumn and Mute from their 2017 EP Implosions.

title: Blossoms of a Swan
synopsis:
mattgnaw and TAMARA deliver an improvised performance blending electronic-experimental music and their original writing.
  Their sound offers listeners an honest, experimental portal into their innermost worlds. Together, they will perform improvisational renditions of their existing music, grounded in ambient-electronic textures alongside ethereal vocals.

title: Intermission Party Programme
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis: Fresh off their latest EP Modern Desires, Intermission returns to spread infectious grooves layered with loose guitars and tight disco backbeats. Expect new tunes, old favourites, good company and a great time.

title: When Music Was Magic – Classic Hits of the '70s
synopsis:
Take a trip back to the ’70s and relive the magic of legendary artists like The Beatles, Stevie Wonder, Eagles, Kansas, Queen, and more with Shak and Bennett.
  Upsize your music experience by first catching the ticketed performance An Afternoon with The Vibes: ABBA Tribute at the Esplanade Concert Hall at 3pm!

title: The Hijack Hayley Show
synopsis: After a slew of shows following their debut EP album Counterpart EP, the band revamped themselves and with a new line-up. Hijack Hayley’s frontman shares “With the inclusion of Hijack Hayley’s new members, we are moving at a more impactful pace, as a band and as a brand too. Creatively, we often find ourselves in pockets of musical epiphany when the four of us meet up. And that fuels an entire new process for us a band.” With renewed momentum, Hijack Hayley aims to push the envelope even further, showing no sign of slowing down. Hijack Hayley is set to drop their debut LP early 2026.

title: Solista 5
synopsis: Join Associate Principal Flute ME2 Teo Shao Ming for a captivating evening of music, featuring works such as Herman Beeftink’s 𝙁𝙖𝙣𝙩𝙖𝙨𝙞𝙖 𝙛𝙤𝙧 𝙁𝙡𝙪𝙩𝙚 𝙎𝙤𝙡𝙤 “𝙁𝙖𝙣𝙩𝙖𝙨𝙞𝙖” and Lowell Lierbermann’s 𝙎𝙤𝙣𝙖𝙩𝙖 𝙛𝙤𝙧 𝙁𝙡𝙪𝙩𝙚 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙋𝙞𝙖𝙣𝙤. Section Flute ME1 Matthew Tan Wan Chong will open the programme with Johann Sebastian Bach’s 𝙋𝙖𝙧𝙩𝙞𝙩𝙖 𝙞𝙣 𝘼 𝙈𝙞𝙣𝙤𝙧.

title: FXTRT Presents: Here For A Good Time, Here For A Long Time
address: DBS Foundation Outdoor Theatre at Esplanade
synopsis:
Local math-rock band, FXTRT, is finally back at Esplanade. The veteran band, no stranger to the stage, returns with their infectious energy to perform their full-length album Here For A Good Time, Here For A Long Time in its entirety. Expect zesty riffs and personal lyrics as these late-20s men—who still call themselves boys—yap about romance, mental health, social structures and being Singaporean. It doesn’t matter if you’ve been here for a long time or not, come down for a good time.
  Singaporean-to-Singaporean fourth-wall-break: It’s free so come after work!

title: Lagu-Lagu Gambus
synopsis:
At the heart of this performance is the resonant sound of the gambus, a Middle Eastern chordophone, playing the expressive and melodious tunes of traditional Malay music. Through its delicate touch, the gambus brings new colour to familiar tunes, weaving seamlessly with the intricate rhythms and musical forms of the Malay genre. 
  Tracing a journey through the Malays’ rich cultural history, the performance reveals shared influences between traditional Malay music and Middle Eastern musical traditions. By placing the gambus at the centre of this dialogue, the music moves gently across cultural boundaries, offering a thoughtful and harmonious listening experience that celebrates tradition, exchange and diversity.

title: Mari Beronggeng
synopsis: Immerse yourself in lively Malay folk music and joget (dance) as street musicians rework classic tunes and rhythms from a bygone era. Brimming with energy, the performance encourages audiences to join in the fun and dance along to some Malay folk goodness!

title: Nada Nusantara: Gema Keroncong
synopsis:
Keroncong emerged as an adaptation of Portuguese musical traditions brought by sailors to Indonesian port cities in the 16th century. By the late 19th century, it had grown into a popular music form across the Indonesian archipelago, later extending to Malaysia and Singapore as part of the wider spectrum of Malay music.
  Nobat Kota Singa, an active keroncong ensemble in Singapore, presents a showcase featuring keroncong asli and langgam repertoire alongside traditional and contemporary Malay songs. The programme highlights the depth and richness of the genre, celebrating its intricate cak–cuk rhythms, distinctive cello techniques, and the flowing melodic lines of guitar and violin.
